skill.name: review-changes
skill.description: Code review of current git changes, compare to related plan if exists, identify bad engineering, over-engineering, or suboptimal solutions. Use when user asks to review changes, check git diff, validate implementation quality, or assess code changes.
skill.summary: Code review of current git changes, compare to related plan if exists, identify bad engineering, ove...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only instructional content for code review. No executable code, no network calls, no file writes. All capabilities are inherent to the AI's built-in tools.

content.value_statement: Manual code review is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides a systematic framework for reviewing git changes, checking plan compliance, and identifying engineering issues with specific line numbers and actionable recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Review git changes with git status, diff, and diff HEAD commands
Compare implementation against existing plans in .plans directory
Identify bad engineering patterns like bugs, missing error handling, and security issues
Detect over-engineering including unnecessary abstraction and premature optimization
Find suboptimal solutions such as code duplication and incorrect patterns
Verify 100% issue/task requirement coverage before approval
limitations: Does not modify code - review only, no implementation changes
Requires git repository with changes to review
Does not execute tests or verify functionality
Depends on AI's file reading capabilities for detailed analysis

use_cases.title: Pre-merge Code Review
use_cases.description: Review pull request changes before merging to catch bugs, security issues, and quality problems early

use_cases.title: Architecture Compliance Check
use_cases.description: Verify implementation matches architectural plans and identify scope creep or deviation from design

use_cases.title: Standard Enforcement
use_cases.description: Systematically enforce coding standards, detect anti-patterns, and ensure consistency across codebase

prompt_templates.title: Basic Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the review-changes skill to review all current git changes in this repository

prompt_templates.title: Plan Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the review-changes skill to review changes and verify they match the plan in .plans/ directory

prompt_templates.title: Security Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the review-changes skill with focus on security issues, bugs, and critical engineering problems

prompt_templates.title: Issue Coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the review-changes skill to verify that all requirements from GitHub issue are implemented

output_examples.input: Review the current git changes in this branch against the plan in .plans/feature-auth.md
output: Code Review Complete - Assessment: REQUEST CHANGES
Critical Issues (2): Logic bug in auth.ts:125 (assignment vs equality), Unhandled promise in client.ts:67
High Priority (2): Over-engineering in formatter.ts, Missing error handling in multiple files
Plan Compliance: Partial match - Some scope creep detected
Must Fix Before Merge: Fix security bug, add error handling, remove legacy code per REMOVAL SPEC

best_practices: Always verify issue/task coverage is 100% before approving changes
Reference specific file paths and line numbers for every issue found
Compare implementation against plans when available to catch scope creep
anti_patterns: Approving code without checking plan compliance or requirement coverage
Reviewing only some files and missing changed files
Not distinguishing between critical bugs and low-priority suggestions

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses built-in git and file reading capabilities.

faq.question: How many files can this skill review at once?
faq.answer: The skill reviews all changed files in the git diff. Very large diffs may take longer to process completely.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill explicitly states it is review only and never edits files. It only analyzes and reports findings.

faq.question: Is my code data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. Code is only read locally for analysis and never sent anywhere.

faq.question: What if no plan exists for the changes?
faq.answer: The skill reviews against general best practices when no plan exists in the .plans/ directory.

faq.question: How is this different from static analysis tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides human judgment on architecture, design decisions, and plan compliance that automated tools cannot assess.
